page.title: 12A village christening
page.content: Charlotte Kate, our daughter,was baptised in the village church. She wore the cream silk robe her father had worn.I like to think our grandchildren, even great-grandchildren will wear it - tradition is comforting. Children from the village school led the service, reading prayers,singing to us and leading the hymns. Their proud parents watched. We,prouder still, watched Charlotte. With her Godparents we moved to the chancel steps, and promising a Christian upbringing for our child, the sign of the cross was made on her head. With other members of the family we gathered round the font as Charlotte was baptised- the holy water poured on her head. It was a special moment! Returning home, we celebrated, presents were opened, and champagne flowed. Charlotte, her role fulfilled, slept.
